popt4jlib.DE

Class FastDblArray1VectorLHSRndMaker

  • java.lang.Object
    • popt4jlib.DE.FastDblArray1VectorLHSRndMaker
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    VectorIntfRndMakerIntf

    public class FastDblArray1VectorLHSRndMaker
extends java.lang.Object
implements VectorIntfRndMakerIntf
    the class generates random vectors in R^n as VectorIntf objects that obey certain bounding-box constraints, utilizing the Latin Hypercube Sampling technique (LHS).

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011-2019

    Company:

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ioannis T. Christou

    • Constructor Detail

      • FastDblArray1VectorLHSRndMaker

        public FastDblArray1VectorLHSRndMaker(java.util.HashMap params)
        constructor. The parameters that must be passed in (the HashMap arg) are as follows:
        • <"dde.numdimensions", Integer nd> mandatory, num. of dimensions
        • <"dde.popsize", Integer m> mandatory, number of intervals to partition each dimension's domain
        • <"dde.minargval", Double v> optional, the min. value that any component of the returned vector may assume
        • <"dde.maxargval", Double v> optional, the max. value that any component of the returned vector may assume
        • <"dde.minargval"+$i$, Double v> optional, the min. value that the i-th component of the returned vector may assume (i={0,1,...nd.intValue()-1})
        • <"dde.maxargval"+$i$, Double v> optional, the max. value that the i-th component of the returned vector may assume (i={0,1,...nd.intValue()-1})

        The "local" constraints can only impose more strict constraints on the variables, but cannot be used to "over-ride" a global constraint to make the domain of the variable wider.

        Parameters:
        params - HashMap

    • Method Detail

      • createNewRandomVector

        public VectorIntf createNewRandomVector(java.util.Random r)
                                 throws OptimizerException
        returns a VectorIntf object whose dimensionality is equal to the parameter specified in the construction process by the key "dde.numdimensions". The returned VectorIntf will obey the bounding-box constraints specified in the construction process, and will be constructed according to the Latin Hypercube Sampling technique. Note: it is not worth it to use pooling mechanisms in this class, as this class and this method in particular is only used in the initialization phase of the DE algorithm (population initialization).
        Specified by:
        createNewRandomVector in interface VectorIntfRndMakerIntf
        Parameters:
        r - Random
        Returns:
        VectorIntf
        Throws:
        OptimizerException
